attributes.additional_details: Government are responsible for making sure NHS workers get paid. MPs have consistently voted to give themselves a pay-rise, voted against NHS pay-rises, and refused to show that they actually respect the work NHS staff do. The situation is more dire than ever, the NHS is more constrained than ever, and mental health and financial stability hangs in the balance. If government truly want to honour the NHS workers as heroes, they must show it. They must literally pay in respect.
attributes.background: Give all key workers in the NHS a pay-rise in accordance with the vastly increased difficulty of their job during a pandemic.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Increase pay for all NHS staff by 15%: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/565151

We should increase the pay of our NHS staff by 25%: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/563356

The UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for setting MPs' pay. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' expenses and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government.

You can find out more about IPSA here: https://www.theipsa.org.uk/about-us/
